con:call.name: Request 1
con:call.con:request: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:nlp="http://nlptoolkit.cloudapp.net"> <soapenv:Header/> <soapenv:Body> <nlp:ReportAnalysesSelection> <!--Optional:--> <nlp:appId>?</nlp:appId> <!--Optional:--> <nlp:words> <!--Zero or more repetitions:--> <nlp:string>?</nlp:string> </nlp:words> <!--Optional:--> <nlp:context>?</nlp:context> <!--Optional:--> <nlp:analyses> <!--Zero or more repetitions:--> <nlp:SarfAnalysis> <!--Optional:--> <nlp:DiacToken>?</nlp:DiacToken> <!--Optional:--> <nlp:Stem>?</nlp:Stem> <!--Optional:--> <nlp:Root>?</nlp:Root> <!--Optional:--> <nlp:Pattern>?</nlp:Pattern> <nlp:Pos>?</nlp:Pos> <nlp:Prefix1>?</nlp:Prefix1> <nlp:Prefix2>?</nlp:Prefix2> <nlp:Prefix3>?</nlp:Prefix3> <nlp:Suffix1>?</nlp:Suffix1> <nlp:Suffix2>?</nlp:Suffix2> <nlp:Suffix3>?</nlp:Suffix3> <nlp:IsDefinitiveAL>?</nlp:IsDefinitiveAL> <nlp:IsNunation>?</nlp:IsNunation> <nlp:IsBorrowedWord>?</nlp:IsBorrowedWord> <nlp:IsProperName>?</nlp:IsProperName> <nlp:IsTitle>?</nlp:IsTitle> <nlp:Nunatable>?</nlp:Nunatable> <nlp:AccusativeNunatable>?</nlp:AccusativeNunatable> <nlp:GeneativeNunatable>?</nlp:GeneativeNunatable> <nlp:NominativeNunatable>?</nlp:NominativeNunatable> <nlp:Prop100>?</nlp:Prop100> <nlp:Prop90>?</nlp:Prop90> <nlp:Prop80>?</nlp:Prop80> <nlp:Prop70>?</nlp:Prop70> <nlp:Prop60>?</nlp:Prop60> <nlp:Prop50>?</nlp:Prop50> <nlp:Prop40>?</nlp:Prop40> <nlp:Prop30>?</nlp:Prop30> <nlp:Prop20>?</nlp:Prop20> <nlp:Prop10>?</nlp:Prop10> <nlp:Prop0>?</nlp:Prop0> <nlp:CaseEndingIncluded>?</nlp:CaseEndingIncluded> <nlp:VerbPos>?</nlp:VerbPos> <nlp:MorphoSyntacticFeatures>?</nlp:MorphoSyntacticFeatures> <nlp:Probability>?</nlp:Probability> </nlp:SarfAnalysis> </nlp:analyses> </nlp:ReportAnalysesSelection> </soapenv:Body> </soapenv:Envelope>

con:part.con:content: <summary> Sarf APIs. Contains morphological analysis and feedback APIs. </summary> Analyzes a given word and suggests all possible analyses of the word. If input word is fully or partially diacritized, all analyses that dont match the input diacritics will be filtered out. Your Application Guid Unicode word to be analyzed One of the enumerated values All possible analyses of the word SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes This sample shows how to call the AnalyzeToken method and report your feedback. using (SarfServiceClient SarfClient = new SarfServiceClient()) { string AppID = "XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX"; SarfAnalysis[] AllAnalyses = null; // Split an Arabic line of text into tokens string[] Tokens = textArabicLine.Text.Split(new char[] { ' ' }, StringSplitOptions.RemoveEmptyEntries); foreach (string Token in Tokens) { // Analyze each token using Sarf SarfErrorCode RetCode = SarfClient.AnalyzeToken(AppID, Token, LinguisticMode.Classical, out AllAnalyses); if (RetCode == SarfErrorCode.Success) { foreach (SarfAnalysis an in AllAnalyses) { // Display the analysis listResults.Items.Add(an.DiacToken + ", " + an.Pos); // Some processing or user input ... // If the analysis is wrong, it is recommended to report it for enhancing Sarf performance SarfClient.ReportWrongAnalysis(AppID, Token, textArabicLine.Text, an); } // Some processing or user input ... // If the analysis is wrong, it is recommended to report it // by forming a new analysis or modifying an existing analysis SarfAnalysis newAnalysis = new SarfAnalysis(); // Fill as much fields as available newAnalysis.DiacToken = SomeDiacritizedWord; newAnalysis.Stem = WordStem; newAnalysis.Root = WordRoot; newAnalysis.Pattern = WordPattern; newAnalysis.Pos = WordPartOfSpeech; // Suggest the new analysis SarfClient.SuggestMissingAnalysis(AppID, Token, textArabicLine.Text, newAnalysis); } else { MessageBox.Show("Failed with error code " + RetCode.ToString()); } } } ]]> Analyzes a given array of words and suggests all possible analyses of each word. Your Application Guid Array of unicode words to be analyzed. Maximum array length is 30 tokens. One of the enumerated values All possible analyses of each word SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]> Synthesizes the final form word given the constituents of a word (prefix/suffix/stem) through the analysis structure Your Application Guid Analysis for which final word need to be determined One of the enumerated values Modified analysis that contains the final form word SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]> Synthesizes the final form words array given the constituents of a word (prefix/suffix/stem) through the analysis structure array Your Application Guid Analysis array for which final words need to be determined. Maximum array length is 30 words. One of the enumerated values Modified analysis array that contains the final form words SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]> Transforms between singular and plural forms Your Application Guid Singular analysis for which plural to be determined If true, work on stem and ignore attached affixes Plural analysis SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]> Transforms between plural and singular forms Your Application Guid Plural analysis for which singular to be determined If true, work on stem and ignore attached affixes Singular analysis SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]> Retrieves all possible inflections of a given word with a hard limit of 500 inflections per call. Use GetInflectionsEx to retrieve all available inflections. Your Application Guid Analysis for which all possible inflections are to be determined One of the enumerated values If true, returns the diacritized inflected forms, else returns undiacritized forms Returned inflections array The total number of available inflections SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]> Retrieves all possible inflections of a given word with a hard limit of 500 inflections per call starting from a given index Your Application Guid Analysis for which all possible inflections are to be determined One of the enumerated values If true, returns the diacritized inflected forms, else returns undiacritized forms Maximum number of inflections to be returned Start index of the inflections to return Returned inflections array The total number of available inflections SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]> Retrieves a specific derivative for a given analysis, by specifying the target part of speech Your Application Guid Analysis for which derivatives need to be determined Target part of speech If true, work on stem and ignore attached affixes Derivative analyses SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]> Retrieves all possible derivatives of a given analysis Your Application Guid Analysis for which derivatives need to be determine If true, work on stem and ignore attached affixes Derivative analyses SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]> Decode syntactic features binary code to a SyntacticFeatures object Your Application Guid Morphological syntactic features binary code found in Returned SyntacticFeatures object SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes ]]> Encode SyntacticFeatures object into a syntactic features binary code Your Application Guid SyntacticFeatures object to encode Returned morphological syntactic features binary code SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes ]]> Suggests that a new valid analysis that should be added to the analyses returned for a given word Your Application Guid The word for which to suggest the new analysis The text context in which the word appeared, can be one line of text or a 5 to 9 words window. Maximum length is 250 characters. The valid analysis that is missing SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes See for an example. ]]> Reports that a wrong analysis is returned for a given word Your Application Guid The word for which to report the wrong analysis The text context in which the word appeared, can be one line of text or a 5 to 9 words window. Maximum length is 250 characters. The wrong analysis that was returned SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes See for an example. ]]> Reports that this analysis was selected as a result of later processing after calling or Your Application Guid The word for which to report the selected analysis The text context in which the word appeared, can be one line of text or a 5 to 9 words window. Maximum length is 250 characters. The selected word analysis SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]> Reports that these analyses were selected as a result of later processing after calling or Your Application Guid The words for which to report the selected analyses. Maximum array length is 30 words. The text context in which the word appeared, can be one line of text or a 5 to 9 words window. Maximum length is 250 characters. The selected words analyses SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]> Reports that a wrong word was synthesized for a given analysis Your Application Guid The analysis by which the word is synthesized The text context in which the word appeared, can be one line of text or a 5 to 9 words window. Maximum length is 250 characters. The wrongly synthesized word that was returned for the given analysis SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]> Suggests a new valid analysis that should be a derivative for a given input analysis Your Application Guid The input analysis for which the new alaysis should be a derivative The text context in which the word appeared, can be one line of text or a 5 to 9 words window. Maximum length is 250 characters. The derivative analysis that should be added SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]> Reports that a wrong derivative analysis was returned for a given input analysis Your Application Guid The input analysis for which the wrong derivative was returned The text context in which the word appeared, can be one line of text or a 5 to 9 words window. Maximum length is 250 characters. The wrong derivative analysis that was returned SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]> Suggests a new valid inflection for a given analysis Your Application Guid The text context in which the word appeared, can be one line of text or a 5 to 9 words window. Maximum length is 250 characters. The inflection that should be added SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]> Reports that a wrong inflection was returned for a given analysis Your Application Guid The analysis for which the wrong inflection was returned The text context in which the word appeared, can be one line of text or a 5 to 9 words window. Maximum length is 250 characters. The wrong inflection that was returned SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]> Suggests the corerct plural/singulare form for a given singular/plural form Your Application Guid The singular form The plural form The text context in which the word appeared, can be one line of text or a 5 to 9 words window. Maximum length is 250 characters. SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]> Reports that the returned plural/singulare form for a given singular/plural form is wrong Your Application Guid The singular form The plural form The text context in which the word appeared, can be one line of text or a 5 to 9 words window. Maximum length is 250 characters. SarfErrorCode.Success or one of Sarf error codes]]>

<xs:schema elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="http://nlptoolkit.cloudapp.net" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="http://nlptoolkit.cloudapp.net"> <xs:element name="AnalyzeToken"> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="appId" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="word" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="lingMode" type="tns:LinguisticMode"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> <xs:simpleType name="LinguisticMode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="Classical"/> <xs:enumeration value="Colloquial"/> <xs:enumeration value="Conversational"/> <xs:enumeration value="ColloquialAndConversational"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:element name="AnalyzeTokenResponse"> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="AnalyzeTokenResult" type="tns:SarfErrorCode"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="analyses" type="tns:ArrayOfSarfAnalysis"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> <xs:simpleType name="SarfErrorCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="Success"/> <xs:enumeration value="ErrorNonInitialized"/> <xs:enumeration value="ErrorAccessDenied"/> <xs:enumeration value="ErrorQuotaExceeded"/> <xs:enumeration value="ErrorAuthintication"/> <xs:enumeration value="ErrorMaxLengthExceeded"/> <xs:enumeration value="ErrorInvalidParameter"/> <xs:enumeration value="ErrorNotImplemented"/> <xs:enumeration value="ErrorUnknown"/> <xs:enumeration value="ErrorInitialization"/> <xs:enumeration value="ErrorInitializationPattern"/> <xs:enumeration value="ErrorInitializationPos"/> <xs:enumeration value="ErrorInitializationPrefix"/> <xs:enumeration value="ErrorInitializationRoot"/> <xs:enumeration value="ErrorInitializationRule"/> <xs:enumeration value="ErrorInitializationStem"/> <xs:enumeration value="ErrorInitializationSuffix"/> <xs:enumeration value="ErrorInitializationCorpus"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="ArrayOfSarfAnalysis"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded" name="SarfAnalysis" nillable="true" type="tns:SarfAnalysis"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="SarfAnalysis"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="DiacToken" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="Stem" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="Root" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="Pattern" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Pos" type="tns:PartOfSpeech"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Prefix1" type="tns:Prefix"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Prefix2" type="tns:Prefix"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Prefix3" type="tns:Prefix"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Suffix1" type="tns:Suffix"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Suffix2" type="tns:Suffix"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Suffix3" type="tns:Suffix"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="IsDefinitiveAL" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="IsNunation" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="IsBorrowedWord" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="IsProperName" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="IsTitle" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Nunatable" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="AccusativeNunatable" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="GeneativeNunatable" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="NominativeNunatable" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Prop100" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Prop90" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Prop80" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Prop70" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Prop60" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Prop50" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Prop40" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Prop30" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Prop20" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Prop10" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Prop0" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="CaseEndingIncluded" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="VerbPos" type="xs:boolean"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="MorphoSyntacticFeatures" type="xs:long"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="Probability" type="xs:float"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="PartOfSpeech"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ESM_ALA"/>
